page.title: 11Local History in Barrhead
page.content: Many of our local{place names}are Celtic in origin. The most common are Auchenback - field on the moor Craig - rock Levern - Noisy water Ars (now known as Aurs) - shallow stream The only{ancient monument}is Arthur's Cross, a stone cross with Celtic markings and designs. It is named after a knight who lived many centuries ago. A{holy well}at Chappell was the site of a religious settlement founded by St. Conval in the sixth century. It is still in evident today. The town has developed from many {little villages}which eventually joined together in 1750. The names of these original villages - Dealston, Grahamston and Gateside are still in use today.
